required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Maturation Within Different Skeletal Growth Patterns Using Maturation Index in Males.
clinical_study.official_title: Skeletal Maturation Within Different Skeletal Growth Patterns Using Cervical Vertebrae Maturation Index in Males.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the difference between the maturation stages between different skeletal growth patterns

detailed_description.textblock: comparing the maturation of different vertical and horizontal growth patterns using CVMI

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the difference between the maturation stages (measured by CVMI index on lateral cephalograms) between different skeletal growth patterns
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the difference between the maturation stages (measured by CVMI index on lateral cephalograms) between different skeletal growth patterns

secondary_outcome.measure: to detect whether there were differences in the onsets of the pre-pubertal, pubertal and post-pubertal stages between the various antero-posterior and vertical skeletal patterns
secondary_outcome.description: to detect whether there were differences in the onsets of the pre-pubertal, pubertal and post-pubertal stages between the various antero-posterior and vertical skeletal patterns

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Only male patients between 8-16 years old with clear sharp cephalometric radiograph, the radiographs which have all the cervical vertebrae will be included in this study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous orthodontic treatment.
- Radiographs of poor quality.
- Any hereditary diseases or syndromes such as Down's syndrome or cleidocranial dysostosis.
- Any disease, trauma or fracture of the jaw that might have affected the normal growth of permanent dentition.
